basics.name: Aurélien Brachet
basics.label: React Native/ReactJS developer
basics.introduction: I am a Fullstack developer dedicated to building eye-catching web applications that prioritize user engagement and accessibility, bringing digital concepts to life with precision.
basics.summary:
Back in 2014, I decided to try my hand at creating simple websites using HTML and CSS. Without even noticing, I found myself learning more and more about web development everyday.

 Fast forward in 2016, after the good old days of JQuery were over I decided to learn ReactJS and built my career around the javascript ecosystem.

 I had the opportunity to work for different type of company, from big corporation to startups. My main focus this days is to keep learning about web development while learning more about different technologies, I have recently felt in love with Golang and vue.

 I most enjoy building software where quality and scalable code is the norm.

work.name: Prium Solutions
work.description:
As the lead ReactJS / React Native developer at Prium Solution, I played a crucial role in leading the development of their web and mobile applications. I collaborated with a team of developers to improve the existing code of their website.

 Key achievements: 

• Conducted an audit of the current web application to identify poor practices and development processes leading to decreased productivity and a strong tendency to create side effects. 
• Redesigned the existing web application, from version 1 to version 2, introducing a more modern technical stack (transitioning from class components to functional components, adopting Vite, React Query, Jest & React Testing Library). 
• Implemented a scalable front-end architecture.
• Developed the Prium One mobile application in React Native.

work.name: folk
work.description:
Short-term mission at Folk with the goal of increasing the application's test coverage.

 Technologies: Jest / React Testing Library / GraphQL

work.name: Egis
work.description:
Development of a POC (Proof of Concept) for creating a front-end application dedicated to managing parking spaces in Amsterdam. 

 Egis had responded to a call for tenders for the development of this application in ReactJS. The purpose of this POC for the client was to choose the development company to collaborate with. 

 This POC allowed them to win the project, which started a few months later. However, I was already committed to another mission and therefore could not continue this adventure with them.

work.name: Log'​in Line
work.description: Short-term mission where I assisted in the development of the Fantasy Rugby World application

work.name: Futur composé
work.description:
I joined the Agile team at FuturComposé as a Lead Developer, bringing my expertise in React Native and software engineering. This mission initially took place over a short period on-site, then fully remotely:

• Analysis and decision-making on technical choices for all web and mobile applications of the project.
• Establishment of the quality process.
• Development of an application in React Native.
• Collaboration with another team in web development (ReactJS) for a joint project, intended to be integrated into both React and React Native applications. 
• Training of one to three profiles in React Native and various development practices. Technologies used: React, React Native, Jest, TypeScript, GitLab & GitLab-CI, NPM.

work.name: FIDME
work.description:
Redesign of the Fidme app (a mobile application with over a million users) to React Native (the previous version had been developed natively and was becoming difficult to maintain).

Development of the application in React Native, following a design established by a UX/UI designer. Collaboration with back-end developers.

Technologies: React Native, Mobx, Jest, git

work.name: dotmind
work.description:
Integration of UX/UI mockups for the development of the FFR (French Rugby Federation) TV section.

Connection with the YouTube API to list their playlist more efficiently directly from their website.

work.name: ACTUM Digital
work.description: Development of a mobile application in React Native for Regiojet, a passenger rail transport company in the Czech Republic and Slovakia. The application was supposed to list tickets based on selected destinations, allow the user to select a seat and purchase a ticket. It was required to incorporate an internationalization mechanism.

education.institution: University of the West of Scotland

education.studyType: Two years technical degree in IT
